revised_title: On the Communication of Regular Double Refraction by Pressure and the Origin of Doubly Refracting Structures
tldr: The author investigates the effects of pressure on the molecular structure of materials, specifically the development of regular double refraction in resinous compounds. Through a series of experiments, he demonstrates that pressure can induce a uniaxial double refraction in the molecules, and discusses the implications for the origin and general phenomena of double refraction in regular crystals.
